name: Python (application development)
description: Many of our current server side solutions have been constructed using Python, though we are looking at other potential options for the future

name: Python (build scripts & infrastructure)
description: Currently used in Terraform and starting to be used in scripting

name: Javascript
description: Used in front-end code, building content models, serverless

name: VueJS
description: Used on more complex UX interactions

name: Jinja2
description: Used for building templates for our CMS driven pages

name: Chai
description: Javascript assertion framework for unit testing

name: Karma
description: Javascript test runner and browser testing

name: nunjucks
description: Javascript templating language, inspired by jinja2

name: shell/bash scripts (build scripts)
description: Used to drive the build process for application and infrastructure

name: AWS SAM (Serverless Application Model)
description: Deploying and managing AWS lambda deployments

name: Helm
description: We found this Kubernetes package manager to be too complicated and confusing. Should be replaced by Terraform plugin in near future

name: Puppet
description: Infrastructure as code used on our Elastic Beanstalks (EB) - we will not be using EB in future

name: Vagrant
description: Local development environment used to spin up application and/or dependencies

name: Elastic Search Stack (Monitoring & Logging)
description: Used for Monitoring and Logging of our applications

name: Elastic Search Stack (Machine Learning
column6: We are investigating these new capabilities of the elastic stack

name: Packer
description: HashiCorp Packer automates the creation of any type of machine image.

name: Integrity
description: We have started to use this to check links on websites

name: Docker
description: Containerisation of our tenant websites,versioning of our website engine
